alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 9:27AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Indian River including areas within the National Park and other small streams in the Sitka area. * WHEN...Until 915 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff will result in minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near the Indian River. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.15-0.3 inches in 1 hour will continue into the late afternoon. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 8:45am the stage was 22.61 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 25.85 feet is expected around 4:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 25.5 feet: Water will begin to flood the National Park Service`s bridge near Sawmill Creek road along with the trail system in the park near the river. Other places in the Sitka area will also begin to see minor flooding issues. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels immediately. - Stay away from steep barren hillsides due to the possible landslide danger.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
